headline: Bitcoin Price Sets Sights on a New Climb ‚Äì Momentum Building Again
summary: Bitcoin price is still above the $117,500 support zone. BTC is rising and might attempt to clear the $118,600 resistance zone to gain bullish momentum. Bitcoin started a decent upward move from the $116,000 zone. The price is trading near $118,500 and the 100 hourly Simple moving average. There is a bearish trend line forming with resistance at $118,620 on the hourly chart of the BTC/USD pair (data feed from Kraken). The pair might start another increase if it clears the $118,620 resistance zone. Bitcoin Price Eyes Upside Break Bitcoin price started a downside correction from the $119,796 high. BTC declined below the $119,000 and $118,500 support levels to enter a short-term bearish zone. The bears pushed the price below the 50% Fib retracement level of the upward move from the $114,733 swing low to the $119,796 high. The decline gained pace and the price even spiked toward the $116,000 support zone where the bulls appeared. They protected the 76.4% Fib retracement level of the upward move from the $114,733 swing low to the $119,796 high. The price is again rising above $118,000. Bitcoin is now trading near $118,500 and the 100 hourly Simple moving average . Immediate resistance on the upside is near the $118,620 level. There is also a bearish trend line forming with resistance at $118,620 on the hourly chart of the BTC/USD pair. The first key resistance is near the $119,200 level. The next resistance could be $119,800. A close above the $119,800 resistance might send the price further higher. In the stated case, the price could rise and test the $120,500 resistance level. Any more gains might send the price toward the $122,500 level. The main target could be $123,200. Another Decline In BTC? If Bitcoin fails to rise above the $118,620 resistance zone, it could start another decline. Immediate support is near the $117,500 level. The first major support is near the $116,250 level. The next support is now near the $116,000 zone. Any more losses might send the price toward the $114,500 support in the near term. The main support sits at $113,500, below which BTC might continue to move down. Technical indicators: Hourly MACD ‚Äì The MACD is now gaining pace in the bullish zone. Hourly RSI (Relative Strength Index) ‚Äì The RSI for BTC/USD is now above the 50 level. Major Support Levels ‚Äì $117,500, followed by $116,250. Major Resistance Levels ‚Äì $118,620 and $119,800.

headline: Pivotal Tornado Cash Trial Nears Verdict: Unpacking the Future of Crypto Privacy
summary: BitcoinWorld Pivotal Tornado Cash Trial Nears Verdict: Unpacking the Future of Crypto Privacy The crypto world holds its breath as the Tornado Cash trial involving co-founder Roman Storm approaches its dramatic conclusion. Charged with serious offenses including money laundering and sanctions evasion, Storm‚Äôs case has become a focal point, setting a potential precedent for decentralized finance (DeFi) and the future of digital privacy. The final arguments have been made, and now, the fate of a key figure in the crypto privacy space rests in the hands of a jury. If convicted, Storm faces the staggering possibility of up to 40 years in prison, a sentence that underscores the gravity of the charges and the intense scrutiny regulators are placing on the crypto industry. Understanding the Tornado Cash Trial: The Core Allegations At the heart of the matter lies Tornado Cash, a decentralized mixing service designed to obscure the origins and destinations of cryptocurrency transactions, thereby enhancing user privacy. While proponents argue its necessity for financial anonymity in a transparent blockchain world, authorities view such tools with suspicion, particularly when they are allegedly used for illicit activities. Roman Storm, alongside fellow co-founder Roman Semenov, was indicted by the U.S. Department of Justice in August 2023, following the U.S. Treasury‚Äôs Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioning of Tornado Cash in August 2022. Money Laundering Conspiracy: Prosecutors allege that Storm and his co-conspirators facilitated over $1 billion in illicit transactions through Tornado Cash, including hundreds of millions of dollars laundered by the Lazarus Group, a North Korean state-sponsored hacking organization. Sanctions Evasion Conspiracy: The charges also include a conspiracy to violate the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) by allegedly helping sanctioned entities evade U.S. sanctions. Unlicensed Money Transmitting Business: The indictment claims that Tornado Cash operated as an unregistered money transmitting business, failing to implement proper anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) programs. The prosecution‚Äôs argument hinges on the assertion that Storm and his team had knowledge of Tornado Cash‚Äôs use by criminals and failed to implement adequate controls to prevent such misuse. They point to communications and the design of the protocol as evidence of intent or at least reckless disregard. Why is the Tornado Cash Trial So Significant for DeFi and Privacy? The outcome of this Tornado Cash trial extends far beyond Roman Storm himself. It represents a pivotal moment for the entire decentralized finance ecosystem and the ongoing debate between financial privacy and regulatory oversight. Here‚Äôs why: The Debate Over Developer Liability One of the most contentious aspects of the case is the question of developer liability. Can developers be held criminally responsible for how their open-source code is used by third parties? The defense argues that Storm merely wrote and deployed code, akin to a software developer creating an operating system that could be used for both legal and illegal purposes. They maintain that the decentralized nature of Tornado Cash meant Storm and his team had no control over its operation once deployed, and therefore, no ability to prevent illicit use. The prosecution, however, contends that Storm‚Äôs involvement went beyond mere code development, asserting he played an active role in promoting and maintaining a service he knew was being exploited by criminals. This legal battle could set a dangerous precedent, potentially chilling innovation in the open-source and DeFi space if developers fear prosecution for the unintended or malicious uses of their creations. The Future of Crypto Privacy Tools Privacy tools like Tornado Cash are fundamental to many in the crypto community who believe in financial anonymity as a core tenet of digital freedom. If the verdict leans towards conviction, it could signal a severe crackdown on all forms of privacy-enhancing technologies within the crypto space, forcing developers to implement more stringent KYC/AML measures, or face similar legal challenges. This would fundamentally alter the landscape of DeFi, potentially pushing privacy-focused projects underground or out of jurisdictions with strict regulations. Navigating the Regulatory Labyrinth The Tornado Cash trial highlights the growing tension between rapidly evolving blockchain technology and traditional legal frameworks. Regulators globally are grappling with how to apply existing laws, designed for centralized financial systems, to decentralized protocols. This case could provide a blueprint for future prosecutions and regulatory actions against other DeFi projects, especially those offering privacy-enhancing features. It underscores the urgent need for clearer regulatory guidelines that balance innovation with consumer protection and national security. The Legal Battle: Prosecution vs. Defense During the trial, both sides presented compelling, albeit contrasting, narratives: The Prosecution‚Äôs Stance: Intent and Facilitation The prosecution focused on demonstrating Storm‚Äôs alleged knowledge and intent. They presented evidence such as: Public Warnings: Arguing that Storm was aware of public warnings and reports linking Tornado Cash to illicit activities, yet continued to operate it. Control Mechanisms: Suggesting that despite claims of decentralization, Storm and his co-founders retained sufficient control to implement compliance measures, but chose not to. Financial Gain: Highlighting the financial benefits derived by the founders from the operation of Tornado Cash. They emphasized the direct link between the service and major hacks, particularly those carried out by the Lazarus Group, portraying Tornado Cash as a critical tool for global cybercrime. The Defense‚Äôs Argument: Open Source and Lack of Control Storm‚Äôs defense team built their case around the principles of open-source software development and the inherent decentralization of Tornado Cash. Their key arguments included: Code as Speech: Asserting that writing and deploying open-source code is a form of protected speech, and developers should not be held liable for its misuse. Decentralization: Emphasizing that once the smart contracts were deployed, they operated autonomously, removing any central control from the developers. They argued that Storm could not ‚Äústop‚Äù Tornado Cash even if he wanted to. Legitimate Use Cases: Highlighting that Tornado Cash had legitimate privacy-preserving uses for individuals and organizations who wished to protect their financial anonymity. The defense also argued that the government‚Äôs interpretation of ‚Äúmoney transmitting business‚Äù is overly broad and misapplies traditional financial regulations to a novel technological paradigm. What Happens Next? The Jury‚Äôs Deliberation With the prosecution and defense having concluded their final arguments, the stage is set for the jury‚Äôs deliberation. This critical phase involves the jury reviewing all the evidence presented during the trial, considering the arguments from both sides, and applying the legal instructions provided by the judge. The process can be lengthy, depending on the complexity of the case and the consensus-building among jurors. The possible outcomes are: Guilty Verdict: If the jury finds Roman Storm guilty on one or more counts, he would face sentencing, potentially including a significant prison term and hefty fines. This would send a strong message to the DeFi community about regulatory enforcement. Not Guilty Verdict: A ‚Äúnot guilty‚Äù verdict would be a major win for privacy advocates and the open-source community, potentially emboldening developers of similar tools. It would also challenge the government‚Äôs approach to regulating decentralized protocols. Hung Jury: If the jury cannot reach a unanimous decision, it results in a hung jury. In such a scenario, the prosecution would have to decide whether to retry the case, which is a common outcome in complex, high-profile trials. The crypto world watches intently, as the jury‚Äôs decision will undoubtedly shape the regulatory landscape for years to come. Conclusion: A Watershed Moment for Crypto and Privacy The Tornado Cash trial of Roman Storm is more than just a legal battle; it‚Äôs a crucible for the core principles of decentralization, privacy, and regulatory oversight in the digital age. The verdict will not only determine the fate of an individual but also cast a long shadow over the future development and adoption of privacy-enhancing technologies and the broader DeFi ecosystem. Regardless of the outcome, this case has undeniably highlighted the urgent need for clearer legal frameworks that can adapt to the rapid pace of technological innovation while safeguarding both individual liberties and national security interests. The crypto community must continue to engage in this crucial dialogue, advocating for responsible innovation and a balanced regulatory approach. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is Tornado Cash? A1: Tornado Cash is a decentralized, non-custodial privacy solution on the Ethereum blockchain. It allows users to deposit cryptocurrencies and withdraw them to a different address, breaking the on-chain link between the source and destination of funds, thereby enhancing transactional privacy. Q2: Why was Tornado Cash sanctioned by the U.S. Treasury? A2: The U.S. Treasury‚Äôs OFAC sanctioned Tornado Cash in August 2022, citing its alleged use by malicious actors, including the North Korean state-sponsored hacking group Lazarus Group, to launder hundreds of millions of dollars from various hacks and illicit activities. Q3: What are the main charges against Roman Storm? A3: Roman Storm faces charges of conspiracy to commit money laundering, conspiracy to commit sanctions evasion, and conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business. These charges stem from his alleged role in developing and promoting Tornado Cash, which prosecutors claim facilitated illicit transactions. Q4: What are the potential implications of a conviction for the crypto industry? A4: A conviction could set a precedent for holding open-source developers liable for the misuse of their creations, potentially stifling innovation in DeFi and privacy-enhancing technologies. It might also lead to stricter regulatory oversight and increased pressure on decentralized projects to implement KYC/AML measures. Q5: What is the defense‚Äôs main argument in the Tornado Cash trial? A5: The defense argues that Roman Storm merely wrote and deployed open-source code, which, once on the blockchain, operated autonomously. They contend that he had no control over how the protocol was used by third parties and that holding developers liable for code misuse would be a dangerous precedent for free speech and innovation. Q6: How long could Roman Storm face in prison if convicted? A6: If convicted on all charges, Roman Storm could face a maximum sentence of up to 40 years in prison, reflecting the severe nature of the alleged financial crimes. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action . This post Pivotal Tornado Cash Trial Nears Verdict: Unpacking the Future of Crypto Privacy first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Strategy Unveils $2.46 Billion Bitcoin Buy, Biggest Purchase In 8 Months
summary: Strategy has just added to its Bitcoin buying spree with a multi-billion dollar purchase, its largest buy since November of last year. Strategy Has Bought Another 21,021 Bitcoin As announced by Strategy Chairman Michael Saylor in an X post , the company has completed a fresh Bitcoin acquisition. With this buy, Strategy has added 21,021 BTC to its holdings at an average price of $117,256 per token. The $2.46 billion purchase was funded using proceeds from the firm‚Äôs initial public offering (IPO) of Variable Rate Series A Perpetual Stretch Preferred Stock (STRC). This IPO, involving 28,011,111 shares, is the largest in the US in 2025 so far. Strategy said in the press release: Once listed on Nasdaq, STRC will be the first U.S. exchange-listed perpetual preferred security issued by a Bitcoin Treasury Company to pay monthly dividends and, we believe, the first U.S. exchange-listed perpetual preferred security to incorporate a board determined monthly dividend rate policy. Following the latest acquisition, the company‚Äôs BTC reserve has grown to 628,791 BTC, with an average cost basis of $73,277 per token or a total investment of $46.08 billion. CryptoQuant community analyst Maartunn has shared a chart in an X post that puts the scale of the new buy into perspective against past ones. As is visible in the above graph, the latest acquisition is Strategy‚Äôs largest since November 24th, around eight months ago. Back then, the firm made a massive purchase that was more than double the new one at $5.43 billion. Earlier in the same month, Michael Saylor‚Äôs company completed a purchase that was also notably larger than the current one, this time worth almost $4.59 billion. At the current exchange rate, Strategy‚Äôs Bitcoin holdings are valued at about $74.04 billion, which reflects a profit of a whopping $27.96 billion or around 60.6%. Thus, the firm‚Äôs reserve is in a comfortable state at the moment. While Strategy continues to HODL, other strong hands appear to have taken to selling, as pointed out by on-chain analytics firm Glassnode in an X post . The above chart shows the ratio between the supply held by the two main divisions of the Bitcoin market: short-term holders (STHs) and long-term holders (LTHs) . Investors who purchased their coins within the past 155 days are placed in the STHs, while those who have held past this threshold belong to the LTHs. From the graph, it‚Äôs visible that the ratio has witnessed a significant negative change of 11% over the past month, implying that a rotation of capital has occurred from the diamond hands to the STHs. ‚ÄúThis pattern has preceded prior ATHs and highlights a structurally consistent shift in investor positioning,‚Äù noted Glassnode. BTC Price At the time of writing, Bitcoin is floating around $117,800, down 1% over the last 24 hours.

headline: Bitcoin Overheating Signals Easing ‚Äì Is A Second-Half Rally Ahead?
summary: Following another rejection at the $120,000 level, Bitcoin (BTC) is beginning to show signs of cooling off ‚Äì potentially setting the stage for another rally in the second half of the year. Some analysts now predict that BTC‚Äôs next top could approach $150,000. Bitcoin‚Äôs Current Overheating Phase Short-Lived According to a CryptoQuant Quicktake post by contributor Crypto Dan, Bitcoin is currently entering a cooling-off period after a short-term overheating phase. The warning signs are most evident in the cohort of BTC held for one day to one week. Related Reading: Bitcoin Flow Pulse Breaks From 2017, 2021 Patterns ‚Äì What It Means For The Rally Crypto Dan shared the following chart showing that this short-term holding cohort is now recording successively lower spikes, suggesting that overheated market conditions are easing. The analyst compared the current environment to previous overheating phases seen between March-October 2024 and January-April 2025. In both instances, the overheating lasted longer and was more intense (shown in red boxes). In contrast, the current overheating conditions (shown in yellow box) show shorter extent and duration compared to the aforementioned two instances. The analyst added: Also, since the recent price increase was relatively modest, we may see a milder and shorter correction in the short term. However, it‚Äôs important to remain patient and look forward to a potential uptrend in the second half of 2025. The increase in BTC‚Äôs price during the latest rally saw the digital asset surge from around $108,000 on July 1 to a new all-time high (ATH) of $123,128 on July 13, before stabilizing around the $117,500 mark at the time of writing. Is BTC Preparing For Its Next Big Move? As Bitcoin consolidates, several analysts suggest the top cryptocurrency may be gearing up for a major move ‚Äì likely to the upside. Veteran crypto analyst Titan of Crypto noted that Bitcoin is currently ‚Äúin a pressure cooker.‚Äù Related Reading: Bitcoin Must Defend This Key Support For $180,000 Year-End Target, Analyst Says Titan of Crypto shared the following chart, highlighting that Bollinger Bands are tightening while volatility is shrinking. At the same time, the Relative Strength Index (RSI) is compressing ‚Äì often a precursor to a breakout. Fellow analyst Ali Martinez added that BTC‚Äôs next top could reach $149,679, based on the Cumulative Value Days Destroyed (CVD) metric. For context, the CVD metric measures whether buyers or sellers are dominating trading volume over time. That said, some warning signs linger. Recently, Bitcoin exchange reserves reached a one-month high, suggesting that some holders may be preparing to sell ‚Äì potentially putting pressure on the current bullish trend. At press time, BTC trades at $117,546, down 0.4% in the past 24 hours. Featured image from Unsplash, charts from CryptoQuant, X, and TradingView.com

headline: Asia Morning Briefing: MSFT, Meta Soar on Strong AI Earnings, But Crypto AI Tokens Fail to Follow
summary: Good Morning, Asia. Here's what's making news in the markets: Welcome to Asia Morning Briefing, a daily summary of top stories during U.S. hours and an overview of market moves and analysis. For a detailed overview of U.S. markets, see CoinDesk's Crypto Daybook Americas. Artificial Intelligence (AI) majors are slightly down despite blockbuster earnings by tech giants Microsoft (MSFT) and Meta, which cited their respective AI efforts as a catalyst for beating earnings. Microsoft‚Äôs cloud revenue jumped 27% to $46.7 billion, with Azure crossing $75 billion annually as demand for AI workloads pushed datacenter capacity past two gigawatts. Meta, meanwhile, reported a 22% year-over-year revenue increase to $47.5 billion, with a 43% operating margin, as AI-powered ad models lifted conversions by up to 5% and engagement on Facebook and Instagram surged. CoinGecko's AI token category, which includes majors like TAO, NEAR, ICP, and RENDER is down 1.4%. In contrast, the CoinDesk 20 , a measure of the performance of the world's largest digital assets, is flat and trading below 4,000. Typically, AI tokens move in sync with earnings from big tech. Nvidia's record-breaking rally in 2024 helped the category push beyond a $10 billion market cap , but bitcoin's rising dominance in the first half of 2025 pulled some air out of the category ‚Äî and other types of altcoins ‚Äî pushing it down to below $5 billion. Traders across the crypto world today also took a breather, given the Fed's recent messaging , which perhaps explains AI tokens' muted reception to MSFT and Meta's success. "While policy remained unchanged, Powell‚Äôs remark that tariff-driven inflation may only be beginning added a layer of uncertainty that pressured risk assets across the board," market maker Enflux wrote in a note to CoinDesk. "With risk appetite fading and macro messaging turning less predictable, markets may remain in a holding pattern until participants gain clarity on inflation direction and policy response for the next few days or weeks," Enflux continued. Nvidia is set to report its earnings towards the end of August. Time will tell if the GPU giant's expected solid results will serve as a catalyst for AI token growth. Market Movements: BTC: Crypto markets turned volatile on Wednesday as hawkish remarks from Fed Chair Jerome Powell triggered over $200 million in liquidations, with bitcoin briefly falling below $116,000. ETH: Ether (ETH) is holding above $3,800, up 1.47%, as corporate treasuries, like SharpLink Gaming continue to bid on the asset for their balance sheet. Gold: Gold fell 1.17% to $3,288.02 on Wednesday as strong U.S. economic data reduced safe-haven demand and reinforced expectations that the Fed will keep rates steady. Nikkei 225: Asia-Pacific markets traded mixed Thursday as investors weighed new U.S. tariffs on South Korean imports and awaited the Bank of Japan‚Äôs expected decision to hold rates steady. S&P 500: The S&P 500 slipped 0.12% to 6,362.90 after Fed Chair Powell signaled no imminent rate cuts amid tariff-driven inflation concerns. Elsewhere in Crypto: Trump's Top Crypto Guys: U.S. DeFi Will Thrive, Assures Bitcoin Reserve Is Coming (CoinDesk) Polygon suffers hour-long outage weeks after complex hard fork (The Block) 10 years on, Ethereum has rebuilt itself time and again without compromising on its values, community members say (The Block)
